intro: Rhamnidium molle, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Rhamnidium molle is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures.
